title: BankAmericard (Later Visa)
overview: Bank of America launches BankAmericard in Fresno, California, the first mass-market credit card, later rebranded as Visa.

title: Mastercard Founded
overview: Master Charge (later Mastercard) is created by a group of banks to compete with BankAmericard, fueling the rise of global credit systems.

title: SWIFT Founded
overview: The Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT) is founded, creating a global standard for secure banking transactions.

title: PayPal Founded
overview: PayPal launches as an online payments company, quickly becoming the leading method for e-commerce transactions on platforms like eBay.

title: EMV Adoption Accelerates
overview: Banks and merchants begin mass adoption of EMV chip-and-PIN cards worldwide, replacing magnetic stripe cards for better security.

title: Bitcoin Introduced
overview: Satoshi Nakamoto publishes the Bitcoin whitepaper and launches the first cryptocurrency blockchain, enabling decentralized money.

title: Apple Pay
overview: Apple launches Apple Pay, allowing contactless mobile payments via NFC on iPhones and Apple Watches, reshaping digital wallets.

title: Neobanking Boom
overview: Digital-first banks like Revolut, Monzo, and N26 surge in popularity, challenging traditional banking with mobile-first financial services.

title: DeFi Expansion
overview: Decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols grow rapidly on Ethereum and other blockchains, offering lending, trading, and yield services outside banks.
